answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Creatinine and blood urea are renal parameters used for assessing kidney function. An increase in these parameters indicates a deterioration of the function of kidneys. The normal value of creatinine is upto 1.4 mg/dl. Infections, dehydration, malnutrition, diabetes, hypertension can cause renal failure there by a raise in creatinine values. Acute renal failure may result from trauma, blood loss, serious infections, poisons, some cancers and biochemical imbalances . A reliable measure of renal function is often expressed to doctors by a creatinine clearance test.I would suggest that you visit a nephrologists to get a complete work up done and advise on treatment.Best.

question: I recently got a blood test and my Doctor called and said I needed to see a Nephrologist because mycreatin level went from 2.0 to 2.5. What kind of danger am I in?This discussion is related to/posts/show/319843.
title: Creatin Levels
